description.narrative: Stöd till uppbyggnad av riksrevisionen Tribunal Administrativo mellan åren 2016-2019 i Mocambique, via en givargemensam fond. Den strategiska plan PLACOR III som ligger till grund för stödet omfattar utbildning av revisorer, finansiering av revision, aktiviteter för ökad transparens, förbättrat IT-system samt revidering av lagar och förordningar.

Support for consolidation of the Supreme Audit Institution, called Tribunal Administrativo, in Mozambique, via a common fund, for the years 2016 - 2919. The support is based on the strategic plan PLACOR III entailing training of auditors, financing of audit activities, activities for improved transparency, improved IT-system, and revision of laws and regulations.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

title.narrative: Agreement amendment National Audit Tribunal Administrativo

description.narrative: 1) During the reporting period 2019 the TA has presented the so called PARECER report and opinion to the National Assembly (Parliament) regarding the accounts corresponding to 2018. The quality of the analysis in the report has improved as well in 2018 and 2019 - it was in 2019 that TA for the first time included in its analysis three more Chapters concerning extractive industries, public works (infrastructures) and public debt. The PARECER report has been discussed both in 2018 and 2019 in the National Assembly and this debate is reflected in the media through all segments of society, with particular emphasis or engagement of civil society organisations (CSOs). The National Assembly calls in the Government (represented by the Minister of Economy and Finance) to respond to the observations made by the TA in the audit report. Whilst the number of concluded audits has decreased, as compared to previous years (650), they have been focused on the risk and materiality (351 concluded, out of 350 planned), the number of audits to the country's key activity sectors for development, such as the state owned entreprises (SOEs) and public private partnerships (PPPs) has substantially increased and overcome the plan. Also, the accounts submitted to TA from the auditees for verification has increased considerably. From this results it may be said that transparency and accountability of the government have been strengthened (goal 2). The Embassy also assesses that the work in 2019 has helped achieved the objective to guarantee administrative and fiscal justice to citizens (goal 1 and 2). 2) During 2018 and 2019 TA has increasingly opened up for the public and shown willingness to engage with key stakeholders (including donors and citizens). The TA communication strategy that has been implemented since 2017 has helped significantly improve visibility of TAs work and products, also at regional and local levels (provinces and districts). 3) TA's provincial financial audits programme introduced in 2016 has led to satifactory results when it comes to improving the control of state spending (goal 1 and 2). 4) TA implements audits in line with plan and a substantial share - 50 percent in 2019 - of the state budget is covered by their external audit. General state accounts are audited by Tribunal Administrativo and timely reported to the Parliament yearly (report called PARECER). 5) Despite judgement delays (when the judges of TA approve and make results official from the audits), there is an improved process for judgement of audits, as well as an ongoing mechanism of follow/up of Audit recommendations and monitoring implemention in place (jointly executed with the Government Internal Audit & Control body, IGF).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
